title: Cellular Systems Engineer
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish! Join us to help deliver system design of next generation groundbreaking radio access networks. Do you love working on challenges that no one has solved yet? As a member of our dynamic group, you will have the unique and rewarding opportunity to craft next generation wireless technology that will have deep impact on future Apple products and inspire millions of Apple’s customers every single day. Wireless technologies have become a crucial part of all Apple devices that delight our customers. In our unit, we have the mission to research and develop wireless technology for next generation radio access networks across different layers (PHY, MAC, CP, DP) We are looking for an industry seasoned expert and with a deep understanding of state of the art wireless technology. In this role you will lead a cutting-edge research group responsible for creating next generation disruptive radio access technologies over the next decade and a 3GPP standards team responsible for Physical Layer and RF RAN groups. You will work on defining system level concepts, proposing and researching innovative ideas & algorithms, performing complex system simulations, defining rapid prototyping platforms to help prove your ideas and specifying RAN protocols and for next generation (6G) cellular systems.
description:
• Contribute to link-level and system simulator modeling and framework design.  
• Take a top-down approach towards system design starting from a use case of relevance to Apple products, defining a problem statement and arriving at groundbreaking innovative solutions  
• Assess the benefit of different proposals to solving a problem  
• Define and provide necessary systems engineering support towards rapid prototyping platform development in the form of system requirements and system design documents
key_qualifications:
Deep knowledge of communication system theory and wireless systems
Strong knowledge of physical layer waveform design, channel coding and PHY/MAC procedures
Strong knowledge of multi-antenna techniques and procedures such as Massive MIMO, mmWave Beamforming and Beam Acquisition, mmWave mesh networks
Strong knowledge of current cellular or Wi-Fi communication standards: eg. 5G (NR), 4G (LTE), IEEE 802.11ax, IEEE 802.11ax/ay/az/be
Demonstrate clarity of thought and strong analytical and problem-solving skills (probability, digital signal processing, linear algebra, random processes, detection and estimation,).
Proven track-record of innovation in the area of wireless system design
Experience in object-oriented programming and wireless system simulator design and implementation
Strong exposure to wireless system design and channel sounder design in very high frequencies (GHz, THz).
Familiarity with L2/L3 user plane and control plane protocol stacks
Familiarity with low power design for smartphones and wearables
Familiarity with wireless system optimization for augmented reality, virtual reality and automotive applications
Familiarity with positioning and ranging based services and solutions.
Familiarity with sensing technologies such as FMCW radar
Strong foundation of machine learning concepts and ability to apply them towards solving problems in sensing and radio access networks
Experience with Matlab, C/C++ and/or Python for algorithm development, modeling (floating-point and fixed-point) and link-level simulation.
Understanding of mmWave antenna array design and RF system design of state-of-the-art mmWave transceivers is a huge plus
Ability to work well both independently and within a team
education_experience: BS with 10+ years of relevant experiences.
